AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: referred to as the Government, party in the legal case, argues about the validity of consent to search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court: held a hearing and entered an opinion and order in Federico Saldana's case, reviewed testimony about drug alerts in a vehicle search, protects individuals from unreasonable searches and seizures, makes reasonable suspicion inquiries based on the totality of circumstances, evaluated the duration and scope of a traffic stop, considers factors in determining voluntariness of consent, concluded that Federico Saldana's consent was voluntary and valid
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office: Employer of detectives Gary Haston, Heather Vargas, and Deputy Jason Cox, involved in drug interdiction cases and utilized a K-9 unit for searches, conducted investigation at a tire shop, participated in traffic stops and vehicle searches on Interstate 35, engaged in detention and questioning of individuals during traffic stops, obtained consent to search vehicles, ensured that detentions did not exceed their original scope, employed narcotics investigators, used persuasive language to elicit cooperation from suspects, referred to as law enforcement or the police
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox: Deputy who initiated the traffic stop on Interstate 35 and handled paperwork for the stop, participated in searching vehicles and retrieving cocaine, had an objectively reasonable suspicion of multiple traffic violations, attempted to locate registration papers, was in the process of gathering relevant information during Gary Haston's questioning, interacted with Federico Saldana in a cooperative manner
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: Detective involved in providing traffic violation information and present at the scene after the stop, participated in searching vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: Individual stopped by Jason Cox, admitted to prior arrests for smuggling illegal aliens and drugs, served 9 years in federal prison, arrested for transporting cocaine, moved to suppress the cocaine under his rights, exhibited unsafe driving behavior, gave consent for vehicle search, was detained during a valid traffic stop, had previously smuggled aliens and drugs using his 18-wheeler, showed signs of nervousness during questioning, demonstrated cooperation with officers during questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: Detective who interrogated Federico Saldana about potential drug trafficking and conducted searches with a K-9 unit, retrieved cocaine from the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer, witnessed and reported traffic violations, asked questions about ownership and trip nature, questioned Federico Saldana during a valid detention, narcotics investigator with 17 years of experience, used persuasive language to elicit cooperation from suspects, gave Federico Saldana clear opportunities to object to or state problems with the search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox and Gary Haston: Conducted cooperative and polite conversation with Federico Saldana regarding his traffic violations and trip itinerary
